title: Medieval and Renaissance Melodies (1 to 3 harps)
description:
Medieval and Renaissance Melodies (1 to 3 harps)
Composer/Author: WEAVER, J.
 

Difficulty: Beginning
Suitable for: Lever Or Pedal Harp
Five tunes from 700 years ago for beginning harp trio. Harp I - melody only (may be played by harp or flute or violin). Harp III is the melody with simple accompaniment, may be played as a solo or with harp I and II. Harp II is accompaniment - needs to be played with harp I, III, or both.

Famous and beautiful piano work arranged for harp duet. Challenging but rewarding.

title: On the Slopes (3 Hps)
description:
Curcio, Stephanie

A favorite excerpted from the White Mountain Suite. This fast moving piece depicts a trip up the ski lift, snapping on boots, schusshing down the slopes, jumping moguls and a "hockey stop" at the end. Lots of interplay between parts in the center section. Fun and challenging.

Curcio, Stephanie

title: Fantasticks Medley (3 Hps)
description:
Jones/Schmidt/arr. Curcio, Stephanie

Medley of pieces from The Fantasticks arranged for 3 pedal harps. Includes: Try To Remember, Much More, Soon It's Gonna Rain, They Were You. May be played as a whole, or each song individually. **Two optional lever parts (easier) are available separately. They are not included in Score and Parts.

title: Wind (3 Hps)
description:
Curcio, Stephanie

Effective, melodic harp trio with a dramatic cadenza, and ending with lots of flashy glisses. Great finale piece.
descriptiontext:
Curcio, Stephanie

Effective, melodic harp trio with a dramatic cadenza, and ending with lots of flashy glisses. Great finale piece.

title: Wild West Suite (3 Hps)
description:
Curcio, Stephanie

Really fun suite of three pieces reminiscent of the Old West. Special effects including tapping, glisses, etc. Includes a lead part that combines themes and and materials derived from other parts that can be used as support for by director instead of conducting.
descriptiontext:

title: Mischief (2 or 3 Hps)
description:
Curcio, Stephanie

Upbeat, jazzy piece with syncopation and fun rhythms. Real crowd pleaser. Comes in duet or trio format which can be combined for a mixed ensemble. Sort of a "big sister" to Frisky.

description:
Curcio, Stephanie

A favorite extracted from the White Mountain Suite.  Very resonant and full sounding with beautiful melody line.  Rewarding to play and perform.  Great for a large ensemble also.

title: Les Miserables (2 or 4 Hps)
description:
Schonberg, Claude-Michel /arr. Curcio, Stephanie

This multiple harp medley is built on five popular themes from the musical. The two formats may be combined for a large ensemble of mixed levels and mixed harp types. The score from the quartet format includes the duo so conductor would have all parts.

Lever parts require 3 flats and some odd lever settings - many lever changes.

title: What Child Is This? / Winter Ayres
description:
Cater, Kathryn

An advanced pedal harp/flute arrangement of this timeless classic, Greensleeves. Arranged by Kathryn Cater and Sandy Norman as played on the Winter Ayres CD. Very cleanly edited with pedal changes marked. There is an option to omit one section. 7 pages. 4 flats and 5 flats with accidentals.

description:
Bizet, G. / Curcio

For 3 pedal harps, or 1 pedal and 4 lever harps.

Parts A - B - C are the pedal parts and will stand alone as a trio.
Parts 1 and 2 = Part A split into top and bottom.
Parts 3 and 4 = Part B split into top and bottom.
Part C requires a pedal harp at all times.
Score contains all parts.

description:
Medieval and Renaissance Melodies (1 to 3 harps)
Composer/Author: WEAVER, J.
 

Difficulty: Beginning
Suitable for: Lever Or Pedal Harp
Five tunes from 700 years ago for beginning harp trio. Harp I - melody only (may be played by harp or flute or violin). Harp III is the melody with simple accompaniment, may be played as a solo or with harp I and II. Harp II is accompaniment - needs to be played with harp I, III, or both.

title: Mischief (2 or 3 Hps)
description:
Curcio, Stephanie

Upbeat, jazzy piece with syncopation and fun rhythms. Real crowd pleaser. Comes in duet or trio format which can be combined for a mixed ensemble. Sort of a "big sister" to Frisky.
descriptiontext:
Curcio, Stephanie

Upbeat, jazzy piece with syncopation and fun rhythms. Real crowd pleaser. Comes in duet or trio format which can be combined for a mixed ensemble. Sort of a "big sister" to Frisky.

title: Les Miserables (2 or 4 Hps)
description:
Schonberg, Claude-Michel /arr. Curcio, Stephanie

This multiple harp medley is built on five popular themes from the musical. The two formats may be combined for a large ensemble of mixed levels and mixed harp types. The score from the quartet format includes the duo so conductor would have all parts.

Lever parts require 3 flats and some odd lever settings - many lever changes.
descriptiontext:
Schonberg, Claude-Michel /arr. Curcio, Stephanie

This multiple harp medley is built on five popular themes from the musical. The two formats may be combined for a large ensemble of mixed levels and mixed harp types. The score from the quartet format includes the duo so conductor would have all parts.

Lever parts require 3 flats and some odd lever settings - many lever changes.

title: Wild West Suite (3 Hps)
description:
Curcio, Stephanie

Really fun suite of three pieces reminiscent of the Old West. Special effects including tapping, glisses, etc. Includes a lead part that combines themes and and materials derived from other parts that can be used as support for by director instead of conducting.

title: Fantasticks Medley (3 Hps)
description:

Medley of pieces from The Fantasticks arranged for 3 pedal harps. Includes: Try To Remember, Much More, Soon It's Gonna Rain, They Were You. May be played as a whole, or each song individually. **Two optional lever parts (easier) are available separately. They are not included in Score and Parts.

description:
Curcio, Stephanie

A favorite extracted from the White Mountain Suite.  Very resonant and full sounding with beautiful melody line.  Rewarding to play and perform.  Great for a large ensemble also.
descriptiontext:
Curcio, Stephanie

title: On the Slopes (3 Hps)
description:
Curcio, Stephanie

A favorite excerpted from the White Mountain Suite. This fast moving piece depicts a trip up the ski lift, snapping on boots, schusshing down the slopes, jumping moguls and a "hockey stop" at the end. Lots of interplay between parts in the center section. Fun and challenging.

description:

Effective, melodic harp trio with a dramatic cadenza, and ending with lots of flashy glisses. Great finale piece.

title: Silent Night (Pedal Hp/Fl)
description:
Cater, Kathryn

This piece modulates from Bb to G and contains lush chords in an improvisatory style. There are a few pedal changes that are well marked. The flute part plays the melody of Silent Night while the harp plays arpeggios and many harpistic patterns creating a rich tapestry that will fill you and your audience with many musical elements. This is a 4-page piece on one 11x17 card stock with one pullout flute part. Requires good technique, therefore is not considered to be an easy arrangement.
